div.p: ~ is a place holder for the home directory, in Ubuntu it's /home/jj. It's best to use an actual path name as I ran into an instance once, somewhere, where I needed a hard coded path.

# set PATH so global node modules install without permission issues
export PATH=~/.npm-global/bin:$PATH

div.div: I was going to paste the whole configuration file here, but I figure its easiest to just download from my github, and do a different chart for nginx config later. An important adjustment I do here is place my nginx conf files in the same conf.d folder, and disregard the nginx default way of doing things, which is two separate folders for "sites-available" & "sites-enabled".

switch.text: I was going to paste the whole configuration file here,...

div.div:
Goals:
Setup new user
Install up to date Node.js
Install Necessary Packages
Download config files and setup nginx
Create placeholder node application
Create a direct link file share
